text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Garda Síochána (Appointment 

to the Ranks of Inspector and Sergeant) (Amendment) Regulations 2025. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 2nd of April 2025.

title: Community Safety Act 2024 (No. 1 of 2024), having consulted with the Garda
heading: 2. The Garda Síochána (Appointment to the Rank of Inspector and
text_raw:
2. The Garda Síochána (Appointment to the Rank of Inspector and 

Sergeant) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 370 of 2021) are amended – 

(a) 

in Regulation 2 – 

(i) 

by the insertion of the following definition: 

“ ‘Act of 2024’ means the Policing, Security and 
Community Safety Act 2024 (No. 1 of 2024);”, 

and 

(ii) by the substitution of the following definition for the 

definition of “member”: 

“ ‘member’ has the same meaning as it has in the Act of 
2024;”, 

(b) by the insertion of the following Regulation after Regulation 4: 

“Board to keep requirement for competitions under review 

4A. (1) The Board shall keep under review the need for 
competitions to be held for the purpose of making appointments 
to specified ranks and shall ensure that the Commissioner has 
arrangements in place to undertake required competitions without 
undue delay. 

(2) The Commissioner shall keep the Board fully informed 
with regard to vacancies likely to arise in a specified rank to 
enable the Board to comply with paragraph (1).”, 

(c) 

in Regulation 5, by the substitution of the following paragraph for 
paragraph (b): 

“(b) an appointments process, 

the 
Commissioner in accordance with these Regulations and 
the Act of 2024.”,

“(1A) A syllabus for

force immediately before the coming into operation of the 
Garda Síochána (Appointment to the Ranks of Inspector

until such time as a new syllabus is determined in

operation.”,

section 16 of the Act of 2005 or section 46 of the Act of 
2024, as the case may be” for “in accordance with section 
16 of the Act of 2005”, and 

in paragraph (c), by the substitution of “the probationary 
period in accordance with the Garda Síochána (Admissions 
and Appointments) Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 470 of 2013) 
or the Policing, Security and Community Safety Act 2024 
(Admissions and Appointments) Regulations 2025” for 
“the probationary period within the meaning of that term in

(g) 

in Regulation 10, by the substitution of “10. A sergeant is 
eligible” for “10. (1) A sergeant is eligible”, 

(h)

(i) 

in paragraph (1), by the substitution of “competent to

competent, capable and available to undertake the duties”, 

(ii) 

in paragraph (2)(c), by the substitution of “code of ethics” 
for “Code of Ethics for the Garda Síochána”,

“(6) 

In this Regulation, “code of ethics” means a code

ethics shall be construed in accordance with section 2(3)(f)

and 

(i) 

in Regulation 16 – 

(i) 

by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph

“(3) Subject to paragraphs (6) and (7), a probationary 
period shall be 12 months from the date of appointment 
under Regulation 12.”, 

(ii) 

in paragraph (4)(a), by the substitution of “adoptive leave, 
carer’s leave, domestic violence leave, leave for medical 
care purposes, maternity leave, parental leave, parent’s 
leave, paternity leave or sick leave” for “maternity leave, 
parent’s leave, paternity leave or adoptive leave”, 

(iii) 

in paragraph (5), by the substitution of the following 
subparagraph for subparagraph (a): 

“(a) Where an appointed person is absent due to a period 
of suspension having been imposed on him or her 
(whether such suspension is imposed under the Act of 
2024, regulations made under the Act of 2024, the 
Garda Síochána (Discipline) Regulations 2007 (S.I. 
No. 214 of 2007) or otherwise), the period of the 
absence shall not be reckonable for probationary 
purposes.”, 

(iv) 

in paragraph (6)(a), by the substitution of “Subject to 
paragraph (7), where an appointed person has not 
demonstrated” for “Where an appointed person has not 
demonstrated”, and 

(v) 

in paragraph (7), by the deletion of “, save in exceptional 
circumstances,”.
